ARABIC: ثُمَّ لَمْ تَكُن فِتْنَتُهُمْ إِلَّآ أَن قَالُوا۟ وَٱللَّهِ رَبِّنَا مَا كُنَّا مُشْرِكِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Then they will have no recourse except to say, 'By Allah, our Lord, we were not idolaters.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then their excuse will be but to say: "By God our Lord, we were not idolaters."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Then they will be able to play no mischief but will say (falsely): 'By Allah, our Lord, we associated none (with You in Your divinity).'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Attempting to answer, they will say, "Lord, we swear by Your Name that we were not pagans".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then they had no fabrication except that they said, “By Allah, our Lord, we were never polytheists!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: There will then be (left) no Fitnah for them but to say: "By Allah, our Lord, we were not those who joined others (in worship with Allah)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then their excuse would be nothing but that they would say: By Allah, our Lord, we were not polytheists.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Then they shall have no proving, but to say, 'By God our Lord, we never associated other gods with Thee.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then will they have no contention save that they will say: By Allah, our Lord, we never were idolaters.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then they will have no excuse but to say, "By God our Lord, we have never been polytheists."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then they will have no excuse but to say: by God our Lord, we have not been associaters.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Then their only excuse will be to say, ‘By Allah, our Lord, we were not polytheists.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: There will then be (left) no subterfuge for them but to say: "By Allah our Lord, we were not those who joined gods with Allah."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: There will then be (left) no Fitnah (excuses or statements or arguments) for them but to say: "By Allah, our Lord, we were not those who joined others in worship with Allah."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Then it was not their trial, but they will say: 'By Allah, our Lord we have never been idolaters'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then their only argument will be to say, “By God, our Lord, we were not idolaters.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then there will be no [excuse upon] examination except they will say, "By Allah, our Lord, we were not those who associated."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [6:23] Then their dissension (read accusative fitnatahum or nominative fitnatuhum) their apology, was (read lam takun or lam yakun) only to say, in other words, [was only] their saying, ‘By God, our Lord (read rabbinā as an adjective of [wa’Llāhi, ‘by God’], or rabbanā as a vocative) we were never idolaters’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then will they have no contention) excuse or answer (save that they will say: By Allah, our Lord, we never were idolaters).
